We independently select these products‚Äîif you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

It‚Äôs only October, but home decor stores are already getting into the holiday spirit. Personally, I‚Äôm taking advantage of these early holiday arrivals by searching for as many vintage-inspired homeware finds as possible. There‚Äôs something inherently comforting and inviting about this style of decorations. Plus, going for a classic aesthetic means you‚Äôll never have to worry about it going out of style! One item that has caught my eye? HomeGoods‚Äô new reddish-pink and white Christmas dinnerware set, which features a perfectly nostalgic print.

TikTok content creator Carissa Nicole (@designedbycarissa) spotlighted the find in a recent video, writing, ‚ÄúThe vintage print with the red color üòç.‚Äù

In the TikTok, Carissa goes through the set‚Äôs many items, which include teapots, serving trays, gravy boats, and dinner plates. Up close, you can see the incredible detailing of the dinnerware pattern, which features vintage-esque illustrations of Christmas standards like candy canes, snowmen, bells, and wreaths.

Judging from the comments on Carissa‚Äôs video, which has received over 63,200 likes, this set is about to be a massive hit with shoppers.

‚Äú*Sighs* gets into car to drive to HomeGoods,‚Äù one commenter wrote. ‚ÄúThe way I would‚Äôve put everything in the cart,‚Äù another TikToker said.

HomeGoods stopped offering online shopping in 2023, so you‚Äôll have to head to your local store to hunt down this vintage-inspired dinnerware yourself. If that‚Äôs not an option for you, Amazon has plenty of great alternatives, including this $95 set from the Bico Store.
